Adjust the transparency of the cover.

Enable this ONLY if you selected \"Entire screen\" when starting capture. Uses motion tracking to reduce flickering, but may not work perfectly.\nIt is HIGHLY recommended to use \"Single app\" recording instead (available on Android 15+, and some devices on Android 14).
Notification permission is required for the service to run in the background
Please enable the accessibility service in Settings first

Shade uses this accessibility service to draw overlay content at full opacity. On Android 12 and above, regular overlays are limited to 80% opacity, which may not fully obscure detected content. Enabling this service allows Shade to display the overlay at any opacity level you choose.\n\nScreen content is captured for on-device processing only. No data is sent anywhere — Shade does not have internet permission.
Shade needs a few permissions to work
Allows Shade to draw a cover over detected content. In Settings, look for \"Installed apps\" or \"Installed services\", then enable Shade.
Required to keep Shade running in the background. You\'ll also see controls to quickly stop or clear the cover.
Single app recording is not supported on this device. Using experimental full screen mode.
Single app recording is not supported on this device. Shade will use the experimental full screen mode instead. This mode might not provide the best experience and quality.
Start Shade automatically when selected apps are opened
Adjust the size of pixels. Higher pixelation can reduce processing load.
Shade detects sensitive content on your screen and pixelates it in real-time.
Adjust detection sensitivity, overlay opacity, and pixelation level in Settings to match your preferences.
Tap "Start Capture" and select "Single app" for the best experience. If you use "Entire screen", enable "Full Screen Mode" in Advanced settings first.
